{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Allow to edit the workspace main label and automatically update the parent node label (Not Possible, as there can be many parents).Alternatively make the main label readonly (only the text, not the position and size, as this might need to be adapted when the text gets longer)","color":2,"key":13,"location":"2211.99999999999 -23193.219953124997","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Kanban adapts position when adding tasks","color":"1","key":14,"location":"2391.999999999999 -23806.515999999996","group":11},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Clean up PictureDSL:\n1) PicturePath is obsolete\n2) Basic Image and Link Image are not easy to understand what is the difference.\n\nSince Link Image can do everything a Basic Image does, why not only keep Link Image (and rename it to Picture - or rename it to Image but also rename the DSL to ImageDSL). ","color":"2","key":15,"location":"2211.99999999999 -22701.263947265623","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"If the selecion editor is open and then the model editor is opened and closed again, the remaining selection editor does not update anymore. {"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Some JS elements use double quotes for numbers which makes them into strings. Probably it might be cleaner/nicer to have them as numbers without the double-quotes","color":"0","key":19,"location":"2211.99999999999 -22550.999982421872","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"When editing text, every word is underlined by squiggly lines suggesting maybe a spell-checker at work. Then the lines should be removed, as it suggests a state of warning.","color":"2","key":21,"location":"2211.99999999999 -23031.13196484375","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Maybe rename \"unset read-only mode\" to \"enable writing\" or \"set writeable mode\" or something similar.","color":"1","key":20,"location":"2211.99999999999 -23786.868","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"If multiple people are inside the same graph and have write access, have some visualization that there might be conflicts. One could do this either on screen level (like the grey/yellow/green border) on per graph element that is actually being modified. The first suggestion should trigger the desire of the people to press \"save\" very often, the second suggestion might allow more paralellism, but I don't known what happens if someone edits multiple elements before saving and the other one edits one of the elements thate were modified but currently are not actually edited.","color":"1","key":22,"location":"2211.99999999999 -23439.7478828125","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"As some kanban elements might contain lots of text, can we have the possibility to change the width of the kanban column? Another option would be to have a short description shown on kanban level, but refer to a detailed description/discussion elsewhere","color":"2","key":24,"location":"2211.99999999999 -22875.175958984375","group":12},
{"category":"KanbanDSL_KanbanCard","label":"Warn, when moving to another graph and the current graph was read-only but you made some changes.
